## What is PyAnsys?

PyAnsys is an ecosystem of Python libraries that provide access to Ansys
simulation capabilities.

![](img/pyansys-logo.jpeg)

::: {style="text-align: center;"}
<https://docs.pyansys.com>
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## The Documentation Challenge

**Challenge:** How do you document 50+ complex scientific libraries consistently?

::::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
**Problems We Face:**

- **Fragmented docs** across 50+ repos
- **Manual updates** lag behind code
- **Poor search** experience
- **Inconsistent UX**
- **API changes and data drift**
- **Multiple teams**, different timezones
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
**The Reality:**

- Users get lost
- Developers spend hours on docs
- APIs change faster than docs
- No unified experience
:::
:::::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Our Solution: One Theme, Many Libraries

> **"One theme. One pipeline. Many libraries."**

**Key Results:**

- **Reduction** in maintenance time
- **Consistent experience** across all libraries
- **Better search rankings** and user satisfaction

## Cluttered and Manual Changelogs

![Sphinx Changelog](img/sphinx-changelog.gif)

## Automated Changelogs with Tabs

::::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
```{mermaid}
graph TD
    A[Add news fragment for each PR by CI] --> B[CI detects changes and releases]
    B --> C[CI combines fragments in to single 
    file and deletes fragments]
    C --> D[Changelog is published 
    with tabs and cards]
```
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
![Automated Changelog](img/auto-changelog.gif)
:::
:::::

## The Future of Scientific Docs

**Key Takeaways:**

1. **Automation is essential** at scale
2. **Centralized themes** reduce overhead
3. **User experience** drives adoption
4. **Accessibility** is not optional
5. **Measure impact** to justify investment
